image.altText: A man and a woman upset while speaking on a podium

props.synopsis: South Australia's police commissioner has given a heartbreaking eulogy at a public twilight service, remembering his son Charlie who had "a big heart and a good soul"

title.children: 'Missed you everyday since': SA police commissioner farewells son Charlie at public memorial service

image.altText: A woman with glasses looking serious in front of a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen South Australian teenagers in state care who are at risk of sexual exploitation and abuse have been unable to get the help they need from a specialist public health service that has reached capacity, according to the state's child protection watchdog

title.children: At-risk South Australian children in care miss out on specialist support, child protection watchdog warns

props.synopsis: An AI-based analysis of 20 years of logging by VicForests, shared exclusively with the ABC, shows for the first time, the potential scale of failed regeneration in Victoria's state forests.

title.children: 'It's basically dead': AI reveals the legacy of decades of logging

image.altText: Drone shot of houses, some with solar panels on their roofs and backyard pools

props.synopsis: Property prices are still growing strongly in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide, but CoreLogic's figures show a slowdown in Sydney and falls for Melbourne and Hobart.Â

title.children: Property prices stablilising after another boom, with rents still going up, especially on apartments

image.altText: A profile shot of a man with a long beard wearing an akubra

props.synopsis: Vince Coulthard says the move by Northern Areas Council is a "racist attack" on Traditional Owners and a step backwards for reconciliation.

title.children: Aboriginal elders 'at a loss' after SA council removes Acknowledgement of Country from documents

image.altText: A man with a beard standing and smiling in front of stairs

props.synopsis: Adelaide 36ers star Isaac Humphries is announced as one of the headline acts for next year's Adelaide Fringe, which after vigorous cross-checking will fit in with his NBL committments.Â

title.children: 'Start of something really awesome': Basketball star takes career to a new stage

image.altText: A person with pink hair and a colourful skirt in their apartment on a cloudy day

props.synopsis: There are over 200,000 Australians with an autism spectrum condition. But lack of healthcare training and understanding is leaving many of them without quality care.

title.children: Misdiagnosed and gaslit: When autistic Australians go to the doctor, it's often a 'traumatic' experience

image.altText: A map showing congested areas in and around the Rozelle Interchange

props.synopsis: The much-discussed Rozelle Interface has proved to have teething problems after opening on Sunday. But experts say it isn't user error.

title.children: Sydney's multi-billion-dollar roadway with chokeholds designers didn't see coming

image.altText: A man in casual dress stands in front of a row of flags

props.synopsis: A review recommends overhauling Australia's strongest secrecy law, parts of which have been described as "unnecessary and oppressive".

title.children: Major overhaul recommended for Australia's 'unnecessary and oppressive' secrecy law

image.altText: A woman and a man pose in front of a grey backdrop, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Advocates say a large part of the challenge of living with HIV isn't treatment, it's society's deeply ingrained stigma. On World AIDS Day, people living with HIV share what it's like disclosing their status and why it's time for a new narrative.Â

title.children: 'Will someone still love me?': What it's like sharing a HIV status in 2023

image.altText: Alaa and his son at the site of their home which has now been reduced to rubble.

props.synopsis: Getting a visitor visa to come to Australia is one thing, getting out of Gaza is another matter entirely. We speak to people inside Gaza who have the visa about the huge challenges they face getting to the Rafa crossing and their relatives here in Australia who are worried sick if theyâll make it alive. Â

title.children: Alaa and his family have a nine hour walk to exit Gaza. He may need to use bribes for safe passage

image.altText: Hands move over a scrabble board covered in tiles

props.synopsis: The board game almost hit the shelves 75 years ago without a board and under a very different moniker: Criss-Crosswords.Â

title.children: Happy birthday, Scrabble â the game that's formed a 'generational' bond for Australian players

image.altText: A young man in a top hat and period dress speaks tersely with an older man in a dishevelled state.

props.synopsis: British actor David Thewlis didn't learn how to pickpocket in his latest role as Fagin, a master pickpocket from Charles Dickens's novel Oliver Twist, but he did get away with stealing a few glass eyeballs from the film set in Australia.

title.children: TV Show the Artful Dodger is a twist on a Charles Dickens classic

image.altText: A small penguin lies down prone asleep on a large rock in the sun, the ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Antarctica's chinstrap penguins could get the same benefit of longer periods of snoozing by taking microsleeps during nesting season, according to a new study documenting one of the most extreme examples of incremental sleep in the animal world.

title.children: Extreme power naps: These penguin parents sleep for four seconds 10,000 times a day

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: The brother has given evidence in a trial against a formerly married couple who owned a regional bakery in the 1980s.

title.children: Brother tried to get sister away from alleged 'cult situation' in regional SA, court hears

image.altText: An aerial photo of a small island

props.synopsis: After nearly 40 years, the founders of one of Australia's most remote island resorts have handed over the keys with the new owners eager to keep alive a "very special place".

title.children: Iconic Sweers Island resort sells with new owners 'excited' to carry on legacy

image.altText: A firefighterÂ stands on a grassy dune and watches a bushfire's flames.

props.synopsis: The bushfire outlook for summer is warning of a scorching summer. Landowners in rural and urban areas are being urged to prepare their properties for the risk of bushfire.

title.children: A scorching summer is expected, so what can you do to prepare for potential bushfires?

image.altText: Man sleeping on the sofa in the living room at home.

props.synopsis: Understanding the science behind why some naps leave you groggy and others leave you revitalised might help you pinpoint the ultimate nap time.Â

title.children: Do you feel groggy or refreshed after a nap? Here's how to find your snoozing sweet spot

image.altText: An Indigenous grandmother looks distraught as she is pictured side on

props.synopsis: As the town of Meekatharra prepares for the funeral of Cleveland Dodd, there are hopes his death will spark desperately needed change in WA's youth detention system.

title.children: As Cleveland Dodd is laid to rest, the calls for change in WA's juvenile justice system only grow louder

image.altText: a white cotton mesh bag with a phone on top showing the green recycle symbol

props.synopsis: How environmentally friendly are the goods you are buying? And how true are the big "green" claims advertisers are making in online ads? New research shows it's easy for marketers to imply their products are "sustainable" without necessarily backing it up.

title.children: What does a recycling emoji or the word 'sustainable' mean in an online ad? A lot of the time, nothing at all

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walking with a friend and her fiance on either side of her.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins breaks down during cross-examination in the Federal Court, after labelling assertions by Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers that her alleged sexual assault was false as "insulting".

title.children: Brittany Higgins cries on stand as Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers suggest she made up rape allegation

image.altText: A building with flags flying in the front and the words Playford Civic Centre written on it

props.synopsis: The suburban Adelaide councillor who introduced the motion said he thought regular acknowledgements of country had gone "overboard", and called for more "inclusive" wording.

title.children: 'It's gone a little too far': Second SA council in a week scraps acknowledgement of country

image.altText: A teenage girl in a white t-shirt and her mother in a black dress sit together outside looking serious.

props.synopsis: A political blame game has ended in the plans for a residential eating disorder centre being shelved indefinitely. The ABC has obtained documents that piece together how it all fell apart.

title.children: Jordynn lives in the one state ditching its plans for a residential eating disorder centre

image.altText: Shane MacGowan performs with The Popes at the Montreux Jazz festival.

props.synopsis: MacGowan, the London-Irish singer-songwriter and frontman ofÂ The Pogues, who penned some of the 1980s most haunting ballads before sinking into alcohol and drug addiction, dies.

title.children: Shane MacGowan, hard-drinking frontman of The Pogues, dies at age 65

image.altText: Anthony albanese wears a grey suit and leans on a table in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Home Affairs boss Mike Pezzullo was shown the door this week, as the policy scramble triggered by the High Court's indefinite detention ruling continues, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.Â

title.children: High Court happenings, a Home Affairs take down, and a rare nice moment: Unpacking this week in parliament

image.altText: A man stands next to a red helicopter parked on an island, with the ocean on the left.

props.synopsis: A man is lucky to be alive after being bitten by a shark off the coast of Cape York Peninsula in Far North Queensland while diving for sea cucumbers.

title.children: Paramedic says shark bite victim 'really lucky' crew members had tourniquet with them

image.altText: protesters on one side while police wearing high-vis vest are on the other side while they struggle with a metal barricade

props.synopsis: Eating dog meat is a centuries-old practice in South Korea but now farmers are angry that the government is banning their industry.

title.children: Dog meat farmers scuffle with police in South Korea over plans to ban the practice

image.altText: A box ofÂ Mounjaro, a drug used for treating type 2 diabetes, sitting on a counter

props.synopsis: A new diabetes medication being prescribed off-label for weight loss is already experiencing shortages, just weeks after becoming available in Australia.

title.children: A new diabetes drug quietly launched in Australia in September. It's already out of stock

image.altText: EMergency service vehicles on beach

props.synopsis: A LifeFlight spokesperson says the rear and front wheels of a ute rolled over the girl at low speed on K'gari before her father performed CPR on her.

title.children: Young girl 'unresponsive' after being run over by ute on popular Queensland island

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says he was "hurt" by personal attacks levelled against him by government minister Anika Wells, who agreed with claims on breakfast television that he was a protector of paedophiles.

title.children: Peter Dutton demands apology from Anika Wells after breakfast television 'paedophile protector' comments

image.altText: Tanya Pliberserk with her hands in the air as it starts to rain at a press conference.

props.synopsis: It took an excommunicated Liberal, former Wallabies captain and the Greens to â depending on who you ask â save or completely stuff the Murray-Darling Basin this week.

title.children: Tasked with drinking from the poisoned chalice, Plibersek lives to fight another day

image.altText: Night club scene with black silhouettes in a crowded warehouse and yellow lights

props.synopsis: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has told young Australians to watch out for needle spiking on overseas holidays. But victims and advocates say that's the wrong message.Â

title.children: Advocates and victims of needle spiking call for more focus on perpetrators and prevention

image.altText: A rescue worker holds an unhappy dog wearing a harness next to a cliff

props.synopsis: Cooper the bull mastiff cross spent nearly seven hours trapped on a 25-metre cliff ledge in Queensland's Glass House Mountains after being spooked by a lightning storm.

title.children: Firefighters rescue 'very cold, shivering dog' stranded for hours on Mount Ngungun cliff ledge

image.altText: A farmer stands beside a sign that says, "Trust me not Google".

props.synopsis: After years of having lost strangers arrive unannounced on his property, Graham AndersonÂ made his own road sign to direct travellers.

title.children: Grazier says 'Trust me, not Google', as travellers led astray by maps

image.altText: A donkey wearing a red harness walks behind several people with piles of rubble on either side of it.

props.synopsis: With Israel's blockade causing fuel shortages, a donkey cart is now the main mode of transport for many residents in Gaza. A video from Khan Younis gives a slow tour of rubble-covered streets and flattened buildings.

title.children: A donkey trots through Khan Younis, showing the structural damage of the war in Gaza
